result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen Scott Vice II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/conditions:  not to operate motor vehicle w/out valid dl.

Defendant Stephen Scott Vice appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel waives reading & advises the defendant qualifies for public defender representation.  Court finds probable cause.  State advises defendant is on a probation hold so bail is a mute issue, no objection to a signature bond.  No objections by defense.  Counsel enters a not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
